### \# App
 The name *Taski* comes from a combination of two words *task* and *skill*. In addition, it is a part of the term *multitasking*. For this reason, an octopus ð was chosen for the app logo. He can be very efficient at multitasking as he has 8 tentacles.
 
 --- 
 ### \# Tasks
 Tasks represent goals or missions that you want to achieve.
 
 * **Goal**\
 Task goal is **mandatory** and must be between 2 and 36 characters long when creating or editing a task. Tasks can be sorted by goal.
 * **Details**\
 Task details are optional and can be up to 100 characters long.
 * **Icon**\
 Task icon can be selected from a variety of ~1000 icons. Icons are grouped by category.
 * **Duration**\
 Task duration can be selected from a wide range between 5 minutes and 10 years. The duration is used as parameter for the experience calculation. Tasks can be sorted by duration.
 * **Difficulty**\
 Task difficulty can be selected from 4 values: *trivial*, *regular*, *hard* and *insane*. The difficulty is used as parameter for the experience calculation. Tasks can be sorted by difficulty.
 * **Deadline**\
 Deadline is optional for tasks. Tasks can be sorted by due date.
 * **Recurrence**\
 Recurrence is optional for tasks. The recurrence can be used to create repetitive tasks, e.g. dailies.
 * **Skills**\
 Skills are optional. One or more skills can be assigned to a single task.
 * **Experience gain**\
 Amount of experience you will get when you complete the task. Tasks can be sorted by experience gain.
 
 #### Actions on tasks:
 
 * **Create**\
 To create a task, press â in *Tasks* menu.
 * **Edit**\
 To edit a task, press the task item to be edited and perform the changes. Further press the *Back* button. Your changes will be saved. If you do not want your changes to be saved press the *CANCEL* button.
 * **Copy**\
 To copy a task, long-press the task item you want to copy. A context menu will appear, press *Copy* to continue.
 * **Complete**\
 To complete a task, swipe left â¬ ï¸ on the task item. To reset the action, press *UNDO* button below.
 * **Fail**\
 To fail a task, swipe right â¡ï¸ on the task item. To reset the action, press *UNDO* button below.
 
 --- 
 ### \# Skills
 Skills represent your personal abilities that you want to work on.
 
 * **Name**\
 Skill name is **mandatory** and must be between 2 and 24 characters long when creating or editing a skill. Skills can be sorted by name.
 * **Category**\
 Skill category is optional and must be between 2 and 24 characters long. Skills can be sorted by category.
 * **Icon**\
 Skill icon can be selected from a variety of ~1000 icons. Icons are grouped by category.
 * **Experience**\
 Amount of experience you have gained so far in this skill by completing tasks. Skills can be sorted by experience.
 * **Level**\
 Level you have reached so far with this skill by completing tasks.
 
 #### Actions on skills:
 
 * **Create**\
 To create a skill, press â in *Skills* menu.
 * **Assign**\
 To assign a skill when creating or editing a task, enter the name of the skill(s) you have already created in *Skills* field. Multiple skills are allowed for a single task.
 * **Edit**\
 To edit a skill, press the skill item to be edited and perform the changes. Further press the *Back* button. Your changes will be saved. If you do not want your changes to be saved press the *CANCEL* button.
 * **Delete**\
 To delete a skill, press the skill item to be deleted and press *DELETE* button. â ï¸ Caution! The progress on this skill will be gone forever. To reset the action, press *UNDO* button below.
 
 --- 
 ### \# Categories
 Skill category represents a group of similar skills which have one thing in common e.g. skills *Reading* ð and *Playing Chess* âï¸ can belong to a category *Intelligence* ð§ .

* **Name**\
 Category name is **mandatory** and must be between 2 and 24 characters long when creating or editing a category. Categories can be sorted by name.
 * **Color**\
 Category color is optional. When a color is chosen all skills associated with the category will have a border of that color in *Skills* menu.
 
 #### Actions on categories:
 
 * **Create**\
 To create a skill category, press â in *Categories* menu. Alternatively, when creating or editing a skill, you can enter the name of the desired category in the *Category* field.
 * **Assign**\
 Enter the name of the category in the *Category* field to assign a category when creating or editing a task. Only one category is allowed per skill.
 * **Edit**\
 To edit a category, swipe left â¬ ï¸ on the category item to be edited. Further a menu with available options will appear.
 * **Delete**\
 To delete a category, swipe left â¬ ï¸ on the category item to be deleted and press *Delete*. â ï¸ Caution! All assigned skills will lose this category. To revert the action press *UNDO* button below.
 
 --- 
 ### \# Experience Calculation
 The calculation of experience depends on two variables: *difficulty* and *duration*.
 Each difficulty has its own multiplication factor *f*:
 
 * **trivial** - 0.5
 * **regular** - 1.0
 * **hard** - 1.5
 * **insane** - 2.0
 
 Each duration value *d* is transformed in minutes. Finally, experience points *xp* are calculated as follows:
 
 > *xp = f * d*
 
 In addition, only completed tasks add to the experience. Failed tasks are ignored in the experience calculation.
 
 --- 
 ### \# Level Calculation
 The level is calculated as follows:
 
 > *level = 0.025 * sqrt(xp)*
 
 --- 
 ### \# Calendar Synchronization
 When calendar synchronization is enabled, all created tasks with a due date will be synchronized with the default calendar. The task goal is selected as title and the task details as description of the calendar event.
 
 To delete completed or failed tasks from the calendar, check the *Delete completed tasks* box in the settings.
 
 If you want to create a task with a due date but without syncing it with the calendar, uncheck the *Synchronize with calendar* box when creating or editing a task.
 
 The default value of *Synchronize with calendar* field depends on the global *Calendar Synchronization* setting.
